channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9659] some integration tests can no longer be run using maven
item.description:
When I run mvn test (or verify) - Dtest=IntegrationTestIngest, the test fails instantly, seemingly because initialization doesn't run. I am assuming junit is not picking before-after methods from the superclass, could be some other issue.

Also, if it does run, it won't be very useful because it runs with calm monkey by default.
We need to detect being run locally rather than as AbstractHBaseTool (probably any time JUnit-annotated methods like Before are called), and set up a different chaos monkey, such as an old default one.

May also apply to other tests.
item.summary: some integration tests can no longer be run using maven

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: patch; refactors setup/cleanup stuff a bit, to make it uniform and not have to add before/after in each test; reduces test runtime under local cluster; makes it so that local cluster runs slowDeterministic CM, which is the new default I guess
Enis Soztutar do you want to take a look?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12607263/HBASE-9659-v0.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 21 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

-1 core zombie tests. There are 1 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TestZooKeeper.testRegionAssignmentAfterMasterRecoveryDueToZKExpiry(TestZooKeeper.java:486)

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7486//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7486//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7486//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-thrift.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7486//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-client.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7486//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7486//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop1-compat.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7486//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7486//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7486//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7486//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7486//console

This message is automatically generated.
+1. Lets get this in if it works for you Sergey.
tried locally, seems to work now. Will commit today to trunk
Sergey Shelukhin Is the test failure repeatable? Should this be in 0.96? Elliott Clark Want to take a look here boss?
it's more of a test setup failure rather than test failure
so yeah it's repeatable

Elliott Clark stack so do you guys want this in 96?
I would say yea, a test clean up seems like a good backport to me. It's too bad that JUnit/surefire aren't picking up the before and after methods. That's really weird.
Actually the issue was not that, some methods were just not marked for the test
+1 on backport to 0.96 Thanks Sergey Shelukhin
96 patch. There was a small amount of rebasing
reopen for 96 patch
ping?
anyway given the patch is almost the same for 96 and trunk, I will take the above +1 as extending from backport to actual patch. Will commit tomorrow morning
